html: On the heels of his people’s collapse from within, their enemies invade from without. Having habitually disregarded Jehovah’s counsel, his people flee from this new threat instead of facing it. Although Jehovah is “a source of strength to those who repulse the attack at the gates” ( Isaiah 28:6), they reject his word. Whereas they formerly put their enemies to flight though they were outnumbered ( Leviticus 26:8), now their enemies who are outnumbered put them to flight. Persons affiliated with Jehovah’s servant, on the other hand—Jehovah’sflagstaff andensign—endure ( Isaiah 11:10; 18:3; 62:10-12).
